intro: Caruncularia massonii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, violet-colored blossoms that are often clustered together, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Caruncularia massonii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
